channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bin collection schedule needs reviewing, 1st September
item.description:
Bins at end properties of Gould Terrace are on a different collection schedule to rest of street, so flats with doors in Gould Terrace have bins that are constantly overflowing and being savaged by foxes, making the street look trampish. Please review.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fourth Time Reporting Stolen Forest Bike, 1st September
item.description:

item.title: Weeding needed, 1st September

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birch Row, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement outside 156 West End Lane, 1st September
item.description:
This is not fixed why did you the report close? Nothing has been done to improve the issue here and no reply on previous report where sent so I will repeat this: Highly uneven and irregular paving, broken cracked paving slabs, irregular kerbs from old closed road formation. Exposed iron work from utility covers "fixed" with temporary tarmac filling that has washed away. Newly paved area towards building dangerously steep and "guarding" this with a couple of planters is not a proper solution. This also restricts pavement width at a crossing point which is unacceptable as people need to stand to wait to cross. This building has been completed for some time now. The public pavement should be made up and levelled correctly. The developers section of the pavement with a steep slope should be correctly addressed and not have 2 obstructive planters as a defence against trips and falls which restricting overall width.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, West End Lane, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed base dumped in Ruskin Drive alley, 1st September
item.description:
Only days after reporting flytipping in Ruskin Drive alley another bed base has been dumped Thank you for always responding but this is becoming an everyday problem here and nothing ever gets done to prevent future dumping

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruskin Drive, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: We need a bin here, 1st September
item.description:
We need a bin here. Many people everyday come to this area to eat fast food from a close take away and many of them leave the garbage there. There is no bin close to this spot. Please put one here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 136-142, New Kent Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing bin, 1st September
item.description:
We have a missing bin in our block so we are just putting the bins on the floor. This means it is attracting rats and foxes which open the rubbish and make a mess. The bin men know about this but said it’s not their job to report. Please give us a bin!!!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tavistock Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
